name: Saving the Orchard
short_description:
We are currently fighting City Hall for permission to maintain and relocate a condemned citrus orchard- for harvesting the fruit and donating it to St. Mary's Food Bank in Phoenix AZ.



Once upon a time these trees were a part of a popular farm called Duncan Family Farms.
School children would take field trips to the farm to learn about agriculture.

Overflights from Luke AFB put the children (and Luke) in danger, so the city shut down the Duncan Family Farms operation and bought the land from them.

So the trees began to die…

Until I saw them and was able to locate a water source and repair leaking irrigation lines in order to bring water to the trees.

Now the city has removed the levers of the water valves in an attempt to starve the trees.

John Yantis, a reporter from the AZ Republic stepped in to bring the story to the local people.  


http://www.azcentral.com/community/swvalley/articles/20130710goodyear-citrus-grove-red-tape-dooms-battle.html
summary: A family in Goodyear AZ is fighting red tape to save a citrus orchard.
